questions.question_text:
What does WWPN uniquely identify in this Fibre Channel fabric?

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. interface
pWWN specifies the logical number for the specific port in the MDS Switch.

Selected Answer: B
It's B
correct ip / snmpv3 / correct port

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

UCS-A /monitoring/snmp-trap # set port port-num
Specifies the port to be used for the SNMP trap.

discussion.content: I think this should be B.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


The network management system that is located at 192.168.10.10 and port 2000 must receive traps from the Cisco UCS Manager called UCSM. The community name is Cisco123! and the SNMP version must be the most secure.

These two commands have already been configured on Cisco UCSM.


UCS-A# scope monitoring -

UCS-A/monitoring # enable snmp -

Which command set completes the SNMP configuration?

choices.D:
fcoe fcf-priority 255 on N9K-A
police 50000
spanning-tree port type edge trunk on Po1
choices.B:
fcoe cost 0 on N9K-A
shape min 0 gbps max 1 gbps
spanning-tree port type edge on Po1
choices.C:
fcoe fcf-priority 0 on N9K-A
hardware qos fc rate-shaper low
spanning-tree port type edge trunk on Po10
choices.A:
fcoe cost 255 on N9K-A
random-detect min 10 max 20
spanning-tree port type edge on Po10

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


An engineer implements an FCoE Unified Fabric where vPC exists between N9K-A and N9K-B. To avoid rate discards, bandwidth must be regulated to account for sent traffic that exceeds the access speed.

Which set of commands completes the configuration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Configuring Traffic Shaping
Traffic shaping is used to control access to available bandwidth and to regulate the flow of traffic in order to avoid congestion that can occur when the sent traffic exceeds the access speed. Because traffic shaping limits the rate of transmission of data, you may use this command only when necessary.

The following example demonstrates how to configure traffic shaper:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/93x/san_switching/configuration/guide/b-cisco-nexus-9000-nx-os-san-switching-configuration-guide-933/b-cisco-nexus-9000-nx-os-san-switching-configuration-guide-933_chapter_01110.html

Selected Answer: C
hardware qos fc rate-shaper low seems to be documented to help with scenarios where sent traffic exceeds bandwidth avaliable

comments.content: interface fc 2/1 instead of interface port 2/1

discussion.content:
Answer seems to be correct
1: NPV Enable
2: Switchport Mode NP
3: Interface Port 2/1
4: Switchport Mode F

C is correct
(config-if)# ip ospf passive-interface > disables neighborship but still advertise the network only on interface ethernet 1/2 as the question asked.
